questions.question_text: Which two statements describe modifying Cisco UCS user accounts? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D

choices.D: Local user accounts override the same account on a remote authentication server, such as TACACS, RADIUS, or LDAP.
choices.B: The admin account is used only to log on by using SSH.
choices.A: Disabling a user account maintains all of the data in the Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect.
choices.C: The password of the user account must contain a minimum of 10 characters.
choices.E: The password of the user account expires in 30 days.

questions.answer_description:
A locally authenticated user account is authenticated directly through the fabric interconnect and can be enabled or disabled by anyone with admin or aaa privileges. After a local user account is disabled, the user cannot log in. The database does not delete the configuration details for disabled local user accounts. If you re-enable a disabled local user account, the account becomes active with the existing configuration, including the username and password.
A remotely authenticated user account is any user account that is authenticated through LDAP, RADIUS, or TACACS+.
If a user maintains a local user account and a remote user account simultaneously, the roles defined in the local user account override those maintained in the remote user account.
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/3-1/ b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_3_1/b_UCSM_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_chapter_01.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
as it speaks about fabric redudancy and not link redudancy.

Selected Answer: B
I think that answer is correct as in question they are asking about that switch which is under Engineer configuration to NPV. So for that one switch we can only add Port Channels to upstream switch

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
D - NPV devices can connect to multiple NPV core switches. In other words, different NP ports can be connected to different NPV core switches.

comments.content: I think this comment more correct than what worte Mr. chachaclacla too,

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D seems to be the only logical answer to me. Port-channel only helps with link level redundancy between the NPV and NPIV switches, it won't help when you need to reboot the NPV switch after enabling the NPV mode. A single NPV device can be attached to multiple upstream switches based on the documentation, but this also wouldn't help the downstream hosts, except if they are connected to both fabrics and only one of the NPV switches was restarted at a time.
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/storage/san_switches/mds9000/sw/rel_3_x/configuration/guides/fm_3_3_1/npv.html

questions.question_text:
An engineer must ensure fabric redundancy when implementing NPV mode on a Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switch.
Which action enables fabric redundancy?

choices.C: Configure the NPV devices to use an external FLOGI database.
choices.B: Add a port channel to upstream switches.
choices.D: Connect the NPV devices to multiple upstream switches.
choices.A: Use TE ports to connect to upstream switches.

questions.question_text:
An engineer is converting a Cisco MDS switch to support NPIV mode.
What should be considered when implementing the solution?

discussion.content:
C is correct
You must globally enable NPIV for all VSANs on the MDS switch to allow the NPIV-enabled applications to use multiple N port identifiers.

reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/mds9000/sw/6_2/configuration/guides/interfaces/nx-os/cli_interfaces/npv.html#34496

Selected Answer: C
C is the one!

choices.D: It requires the FLOGI database to be disabled.
choices.A: It requires mapping of external interface traffic.
choices.C: It must be enabled globally on all VSANs.
choices.B: It must be enabled on VSAN 1 only.

questions.answer_description:
About N Port Identifier Virtualization
N port identifier virtualization (NPIV) provides a means to assign multiple FC IDs to a single N port. This feature allows multiple applications on the N port to use different identifiers and allows access control, zoning, and port security to be implemented at the application level. Figure 1-1 shows an ex-ample application using
NPIV.

Figure 1-1 NPIV Example -

You must globally enable NPIV for all VSANs on the MDS switch to allow the NPIV-enabled applica-tions to use multiple N port identifiers.
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/mds9000/sw/5_0/configuration/guides/int/nxos/cli_interfaces/npv.html

discussion.content:
From Cisco document:-
SUMMARY STEPS

 write erase
 reload
 copy configuration_file running-configuration
 copy running-config startup-config

I think you would do the show startup first to see that it exists. Then start the process otherwise you have been through some unneccary steps. See that it exists, clean and relaod the device, copy the backup to running and save.

comments.content: if you do not erase the running config first, when copying the saved config (in bootflash) to the running cofig it will merge the actual running config with the saved config which is not what the question is asking for and not recommended if you want my advice :)

write erase will delete the startup, not the running config. question is wrong, you can't copy file to the running config, you can instead do a "replace" command. you can copy file to the startup config though, and then reload.

discussion.content:
No reason for "write erase" and "reload".
Just copy the file into both "running-config" and "startup-config".

Answer seems to be correct.

Reference: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/mds9000/sw/nx-os/configuration/guides/fund/fund_nx-os_5-x/b_Cisco_MDS_9000_Series_NX-OS_Fundamentals_Configuration_Guide_Release_5-x/b_Cisco_MDS_9000_Series_NX-OS_Fundamentals_Configuration_Guide_Release_5-x_chapter_01000.html

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
An engineer must recover configuration on a Cisco MDS 9000 Series switch from a previous version that was backed up to bootflash and then verify the restoration.
Drag and drop the commands on the left to the correct order on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Configuring Fibre Channel Destination Port
1. switch# configure terminal
2. switch(config)# interface fc slot/port
3. switch(config-if)# switchport mode SD
4. switch(config-if)# switchport speed 1000
5. switch(config-if)# exit
6. switch(config)# monitor session session-number
7. switch(config-monitor)# destination interface fc slot/port

Selected Answer: A
A is corrrrect

choices.A: The Fibre Channel interface is configured for SPAN.
choices.B: The Fibre Channel interface is configured for source distribution.
choices.D: The Fibre Channel interface is configured for synchronization distribution.
choices.C: The Fibre Channel interface is configured for FSPF.

questions.answer_description:
You can configure a Fibre Channel port as a SPAN destination port.

Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/configuration/guide/cli_rel_4_1/
Cisco_Nexus_5000_Series_Switch_CLI_Software_Configuration_Guide_chapter50.html#task_1168696
